title: Teen killed in double shooting in Cleveland's Union-Miles Park neighborhood
content:
CLEVELAND, Ohio -- A 16-year-old boy was shot to death late Sunday in Cleveland's Union-Miles Park neighborhood.
Percy Wells was killed by gunfire on Miles Avenue near East 104th Street, Cleveland police said.
Cleveland police said they were investigating the theft of a Lincoln SUV on East 93rd and Miles. Police followed the SUV until it crashed on East 100th Street, police said.
The suspects ran off and were not caught, police said. Officers then were called to the shooting scene about a half-mile east on Miles.
By the time they got there, someone had driven Wells and a 35-year-old man to Marymount Hospital. Wells died at the hospital about 10:30 p.m., police said.
The 35-year-old man suffered a gunshot wound to his right thigh and was flown via emergency helicopter to MetroHealth Medical Center, police said. His condition is unknown.
The shooting brings the city's unofficial 2016 homicide total to 74.
